pull.title: Reorder AppInit2
pull.body:
This reorders AppInit2 into 10 sections:
1)  basic setup (OS stuff, signal handlers)
2)  parameter interactions (softset)
3)  interpreting options without side effects (just setting internal variables)
4)  application initialization (datadir lock, daemonize, pidfile, log file)
5)  network initialization (network params, proxy, binding)
6)  load blockchain
7)  load wallet
8)  import blocks (-loadblock=)
9)  load peers
10) start node/rpc threads
11) finished

This means invalid configurations will be detected as soon as possible (in particular, before loading the block chain).

events.body:
Hmm the comment about bitcoin-qt storing settings in wallet can be changed,
as that's deprecated. It now uses its own settings store, and moves the
settings from the wallet on first run. The support for wallet options is
only for backward compatibility.

issue.title: Reorder AppInit2
issue.body:
This reorders AppInit2 into 11 sections:
1) basic setup (OS stuff, signal handlers)
2) parameter interactions (softset)
3) interpreting options without side effects (just setting internal variables)
4) application initialization (datadir lock, daemonize, pidfile, log file)
5) network intialization (network params, proxy, binding)
6) load blockchain
7) load wallet
8) load peers
9) load primenodes and scrape databases
10) start node/rpc threads
11) finished

This means invalid configurations will be detected as soon as possible
(in partciular, before loading the block chain).

reference: bitcoin/bitcoin#1369
